label: 2000 TIP protocol ratification
Description: An indicator (0/1) for whether a country has ratified the UN Palermo Protocol to Prevent, Suppress and Punish Trafficking in Persons Especially Women and Children, supplementing the United Nations Convention against Transnational Organized Crime

label: Worse civil liberties
Description: Freedom House Civil Liberties; 1 to 7 scale, with 1 representing the best civil liberties and 7 the worst.

label: US aid (logged)
Description: The log of Total Aid from the United States constant 2010 $US. We add 1 before taking the log so that the value for no aid is 0.

label: Total population (logged)
Description: The log of total population

label: Regional density of criminalization
Description: A measure capturing the percent of countries in a region that have criminalized trafficking
Source: Generated based on the criminalization variable

label: Trafficking intensity in destination countries
Description: Incidence of reporting of trafficking persons in destination countries. 1=very low; 2=low; 3=medium; 4=high; 5=very high.
Source: 2006 UNODC TIP report, Appendix 5: Incidence of reporting of (destination/origin/tr ansit) countries. The incidence from the 2006 report is extended to all years in the analysis.

label: Trafficking intensity in countries of origin
Description: Incidence of reporting of trafficking persons in origin countries. 1=very low; 2=low; 3=medium; 4=high; 5=very high.
Source: 2006 UNODC TIP report, Appendix 5: Incidence of reporting of (destination/origin/tr ansit) countries. The incidence from the 2006 report is extended to all years in the analysis.

label: Trafficking intensity in transit countries
Description: Incidence of reporting of trafficking persons in transit countries. 1=very low; 2=low; 3=medium; 4=high; 5=very high.
Source: 2006 UNODC TIP report, Appendix 5: Incidence of reporting of (destination/origin/tr ansit) countries. The incidence from the 2006 report is extended to all years in the analysis.

label: Corruption
Description: “Control of corruption captures perceptions of the extent to which public power is exercised for private gain.”

label: NGO density
Description: A count of number of total times the annual US State Department TIP report for a given country mentions the word NGO, divided by the number of reports in the data. Thus, it captures average number of NGO mentions per report for a given country and it is a constant for each country. The data is extended backwards to years before a country was included in the report.
Source: TIP report, variable generated by author

label: GDP (logged)
Description: GDP in current US dollars

label: Total population (logged)
Description: The log of total population

label: Missing information
Description: A count of number of variables for which information is missing in a given year for: Freedom House civil liberties, the International Country Risk Guide corruption score, Erik Voeten’s UN Affinity voting data, and four variables from the World Bank: Net ODA, Intentional homicides, Health expenditures, and GDP. The variable also counts the three variables from the UN incidence data on TIP, adding a one for each of these variables where the UN did not find any information.
Source: Author generated based on included variables and their sources

label: Rule of law
Description: "Rule of law captures perceptions of the extent to which agents have confidence in and abide by the rules of society"

label: US pressure (Watchlist or Tier 3) / Lowest tier
Description: Dichotomous variable (0/1) indicating whether the US has placed the country on the Watchlist or rated the country Tier 3.

label: GDP per capita (logged)
Description: GDP / Total Population (logged) in current US dollars

label: In report
Description: Dichotomous variable indicating whether a country is included in the report.

label: Coverage / Human trafficking news (logged)
Description: The log of the number of times a country's name will appear in a news story in the Lexis-Nexis database within 50 words of the phrase "human trafficking" (or a close cognate)

label: Worse total freedom
Description: Sum of Freedom House political rights and civil liberties scores. 2 to 14 scale, with 2 representing the best total freedom and 7 the worst.

label: Share of total trade with US
Reaction (no media)
Description: Count of non-media reactions in Wikileaks cables

label: Tier 2
Description: Dichotomous variable (0/1) indicating whether the US has rated a country as Tier 2.

label: Watchlist
Description: Dichotomous variable (0/1) indicating whether the US has placed a country on the Tier 2 watch list, which means that it may drop to Tier 3 the following year.

label: Tier 3
Description: Dichotomous variable (0/1) indicating whether the US has rated a country as Tier 3.

label: Criminalization
Description: The complete prohibition of all forms of human trafficking, including sex and labor trafficking for men and women, children and adults. Penalties must be significant, usually meaning minimum sentences of 3-5 years. Note that, because the US trafficking report comes out annually in June, to avoid sequencing errors in our inference, a country is coded as having fully criminalized in a given year only if it had done so prior to the issuance of the report in June. Dates usually refer to the actual enactment of the legislation, but in cases where that information is not available, the month of passage of the legislation is used. If no date could be established, the country was coded as having fully criminalized that year (equivalent to an assumption that it criminalized before the report came out, thus biasing any systematic error against a finding of an effect of the report on criminalization).
Source: UN global report on trafficking, 2009. US TIP reports, domestic legislation from the International Organization of Migration (IOM) database and other sources.

label: First demotion (t−1)
Description: Dichotomous variable (0/1) coded 1 in a year that a country is placed either on the watch list or rated a Tier 3 (without first having been on the watch list) for the first time.

label: First demotion (t−2)
Description: Dichotomous variable (0/1) coded 1 in a year that a country is placed either on the watch list or rated a Tier 3 (without first having been on the watch list) for the first time.

label: First demotion (t−3)
Description: Dichotomous variable (0/1) coded 1 in a year that a country is placed either on the watch list or rated a Tier 3 (without first having been on the watch list) for the first time.

label: Share of women in parliament
Description: Share of voting seats in the lower house of national parliaments held by women (% of total seats), as of the last day of the listed year.
Source: Women in National Parliaments, statistical archive. http://www.ipu.org/ wmn-e/classif- arc.htm, accessed February 2012.

label: Aid greater than $100 million
Description: Dichotomous variable (0/1) indicating whether a country received more than $100 million in aid from the US.

label: Tier 1
Description: Dichotomous variable (0/1) indicating whether the US has rated a country as Tier 1.

label: Total reactions (no media)
Description: Count of non-media reactions in Wikileaks cables

label: US aid as share of total aid (logged)
Description: Proportion of foreign aid from the US out of all received aid.

label: US aid as share of GDP (logged)
FDI from US (logged)
Description: Total amount of foreign direct investment (FDI) from the US.
Source: Bilateral FDI statistics, UN Conference on Trade and Development (http://unctad.org/en/Pages/DIAE/FDI%20Statistics/FDI-Statistics-Bilateral.aspx)

label: Has BIT with US
Description: Dichotomous variable (0/1) indicating whether a country has signed a bilateral investment treaty (BIT) with the US.
Source: Office of the United States Trade Representative (https://ustr.gov/trade-agreements/bilateral-investment-treaties)

label: US trade as share of GDP (logged)
Imports to US (logged)
Description: Total value of imports to the US for a given country.

label: US military aid (logged)
Description: Total military aid provided by the US
